TopicTitle: HGR 1.875m parts R&D Thread [Mod reboot in progress] (First Dev build now available)

Articles.Content:
Thank you but I can't take credit for the fairings. They're procedural fairings. I used the interstage upside down on top, so it will allow for a soyuz style abort. I don't think I'm going to make dedicated fairings as I feel like it forces one single way of using the parts. (Because the craft would have to fit in the fairings, which would be of a specific size) I don't really like the idea of parts that only serve one purpose/build style. But who knows, I often end up doing things that I say I'm not and vise versa.

Thank you for your kind words though. ^^

Have you seen this? It has a nice soyuz style LES. Which reminds me, one nice thing about the proc fairings inerstage adapter is that since you can change the baseplate's size, it can be fitted to any escape tower you could want.

Well, the newest version of PFairings has that ability for the standard base too. I tend to use one at each end, but attach the fairings to the top part. Works like a charm. I should make a newer version of that video I shared a few months back.
The Soyuz panels could be a bit bigger (longer and wider, especially). Otherwise, great work!
Orionkermin, beautiful work sir. I've been having a lot of fun with this and can't stop staring at the texturing. Well done.

I'm a little confused as to the exact shape of the Onion pod. In some pictures it looks more oblong, and in others it looks almost exactly round. (I personally would prefer the round) Also I think the solar panels could only be 1 wide (Instead of the current 2) and it would look much better.

I'm basing the solar panels more on the old soyuz and soyuz apollo test mission, which had taller and less wide panels than the current version. http://historicspacecraft.com/soyuz.html Also when things get Kerbalized they tend to get squished a bit, not to mention looking at them from a limited camera perspective can skew things.

The Onion is very slightly oblong, so from some angles you will be able to tell more than others. If people still don't like the panels after they've gotten to play around with them, then we'll see about changing them.

I will offer this suggestion though: Make your own LES tower/LAS. The stock one does not do your parts justice, and I think one more LES/LAS would be brilliant. Right now, we have stock LES, and an Aerojet Kerbodyne/Orion LES, so a Russian/Soyuz themed LES would be brilliant. It would make the perfect trio, and you would do brilliant job with it.

Actually, PDCWolf did a pack of launch escape systems. It's available here.

Scaled up the solar panels by 10% hopefully that looks better. The silhouette is a good indication of the size and shape of things. (Also I think silhouettes are cool)

The launcher in the picture got the Soy-juice into LKO with about 3/4 of the service compartment's fuel remaining. I think that with a proper lifting engine it'll be even more efficient. The boosters are already only 3 way symmetry, so that's a good sign. I think that by the time .24 rolls around we might have ourselves a nice inexpensive LKO launcher.

EDIT: I should mention that this is with stock aerodynamics, as long as it's stable in FAR it should work there too.

Special thanks to MaverickSawyer for telling me a better way to arrange the fairings.
